ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: My concept of sex and gender was totally revolutionized and I learned how to think critically about sociological writing.
since this class i have begun questioning every single thing about society and how everything relates to sex, gender, race, SES, etc. i loved this class so much

I learned so much in this class! Professor Almeling does an amazing job organizing the course, so even if you know something about gender in some space or for some group of individuals, it's really likely that you will learn or be introduced to something new. I definitely also developed a heightened interest in gender and have been made more aware of it in everyday life. Again, even if you think about gender often or are already interested in it, I think Almeling and this class will challenge you to think about it in new ways. In terms of skills, I really learned to write more succinctly while still being effective, which is a skill that will definitely be useful later on.
more understanding about gender in an analytical lens
I learned how to examine sex and gender through a sociological lens.
gained a knowledge of contemporary sociology on numerous aspects of gender

Before taking this class, I didn't feel as if I had the language to participate in conversations about sex and gender. Now, I do! I am also far more aware of the importance of intersectional thinking.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: super interesting readings, good discussion pace
Weakness: would have loved to get feedback on weekly memos
sometimes discussion was a little stunted or class felt rushed. but overall one of my favorite class i've taken at Yale

One major strength of this course is Prof. Almeling. She is so knowledgeable and really challenges her students. Because of her, you will walk out of this class a more thoughtful writer and someone who thinks critically about gender. This class is also organized really well and all of the assignments were meaningful and fun to do. The workload is also very manageable and all of the readings are really important and interesting. The recorded lectures were also really informative. I really can't imagine any ways that the course could have been improved. The readings are diverse and inclusive and discussion was always excellent.

I think the readings and the discussions were good for developing a foundational understanding of societal conditions of sex and gender and how they influence all sectors of life. I think the readings could be updated/adjusted to be more intersectional and include information that is more relevant to modern trends in sex and gender.
i really enjoyed the discussion format! i found that the class discussions worked really well even given the virtual format

strength - fantastic selection of readings, interesting conversations, weekly memos force you to practice writing concisely 
weakness - not enough time to talk through everything!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Zoom is especially tough for seminar participation, but I think this course was handled as well as possible under the circumstances.
The recorded lectures were helpful and often provided useful background for a topic. Discussion worked really well in this class. I would not say that any of the practices were unsuccessful.
small course size was incredibly helpful for maintaining a seminar environment virtually, and i really appreciated how prof almeling moderated the discussions virtually

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! It's not a lot of work for a lot of intellectual payoff.
absolutely!! amazing professor, incredible readings, assignments are completely tailored to your interests, and there is a strong emphasis on learning not for grades but for the sake of learning

Yes! Professor Almeling is probably the best professor I've had at Yale. Even if there are changes to the class (I think it will be a lecture next year) I know she will make every effort to ensure that everyone is learning and having a good experience in the class. The content is also excellent. Not only will you learn new information, but you will be challenged to think about it really critically. The assignments were always manageable and allowed me to think even more critically about topics I chose and knew I was interested in. Professor Almeling also gives probably the best and most constructive feedback I've ever received, and I definitely left this class a better writer and thinker because of that.
Absolutely !!
yes! the material was interesting and the professor was very accommodating and understanding
Yes, absolutely!! Professor Almeling is incredible, the readings are engaging, and the conversations are so, so interesting. Definitely my favorite class of the semester!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: There were some recorded lectures that were viewed before class.
live seminar + optional meet-up, talks, and other events

extras.title:
WGSS 249 01/SOCY 222 01
        Sex and Gender in Society
